title: API Docs: std::ops

labels.name: E-mentor
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue has a mentor. Use RustcContributor::new on Zulip for discussion.

labels.name: E-help-wanted
labels.description: Call for participation: Help is requested to fix this issue.

labels.name: E-medium
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Medium / intermediate

labels.name: A-docs
labels.description: Area: documentation for any part of the project, including the compiler, standard library, and tools

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: Category: A tracking issue for an RFC or an unstable feature.

body:
Part of https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/29329

http://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ops/

Here's what needs to be done to close out this issue: 

- [ ] [almost all of the traits](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ops/#traits) suffer from "stuttering", that is, their summary lines should drop "the X trait" and say "the X operator", with the symbol. https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/40818
- [ ] [`Range`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ops/struct.Range.html) needs a better summary/explanation distinction.
- [ ] [`RangeFrom`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ops/struct.RangeFrom.html) has the same issue.
- [ ] [`RangeFull`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ops/struct.RangeFull.html) same
- [ ] [`RangeTo`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ops/struct.RangeTo.html) same
- [ ] All of these range traits could use examples of implementing them to let people pass ranges directly, with examples.
- [ ] [`Deref`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ops/trait.Deref.html) is a very important trait with little documentation.
- [ ] [`DerefMut`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ops/trait.DerefMut.html) should link to `Deref`, and vice versa.
- [ ] [`Drop`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ops/trait.Drop.html) is very important yet has little documentation.
- [ ] [`Fn`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ops/trait.Fn.html) has a bad summary and a lot of its explanation is inside of the example.
- [ ] [`FnMut`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ops/trait.FnMut.html) same
- [ ] [`FnOnce`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ops/trait.FnOnce.html) same
- [ ] Some traits only have "prints when called" examples, while others have amazing, real examples. Improving these would be nice but isn't required to close this ticket.
